name: How to do manual SFTP file pushes using BEAM.txt - The HARD way
description: This section explains the manual process of transferring files via SFTP (Secure File Transfer Protocol) to a server called BEAM. It provides step-by-step instructions on how to identify the SFTP account credentials, download the file from a source (email, Slack, etc.), transfer it to a jump box server, and then finally upload it to the BEAM server using either a password or an SSH key authentication method. The process involves multiple steps of copying files between different servers before reaching the final destination.
use_cases: Manually transferring files to the BEAM server
Securely uploading files using SFTP protocol
Authenticating with SFTP using password or SSH key

name: How to do manual SFTP file pushes using BEAM.txt - Easy way
description: This section explains an easy way to manually upload files to a remote SFTP server using BEAM, a tool developed by Razorpay. It provides step-by-step instructions on how to upload a file to a specific SFTP path defined in a BEAM job configuration. The process involves downloading the file, uploading it to an S3 bucket, and then calling the BEAM push API with the job name, bucket details, and file path. The response from the API indicates whether the file transfer was successful or not. The section also mentions an alternative method for testing on a stage environment and how to request access to the test bucket if needed.
use_cases: Manually uploading files to a remote SFTP server
Testing file uploads in a stage environment
Requesting access to a test bucket for SFTP file uploads
